What is the purpose of the `sendcurrency` command in Verus?

The `sendcurrency` command in Verus is used to send one or multiple Verus outputs to one or multiple addresses on the same or another chain. This command allows for flexible and customizable transactions, including conversions between currencies and exports to other chains.

sendcurrency "fromaddress" '[{"address":... ,"amount":...},...]' (minconfs) (feeamount) (returntxtemplate)This sends one or many Verus outputs to one or many addresses on the same or another chain.
Funds are sourced automatically from the current wallet, which must be present, as in sendtoaddress.
If "fromaddress" is specified, all funds will be taken from that address, otherwise funds may come
from any source set of UTXOs controlled by the wallet.Arguments
1. "fromaddress"       (string, required) The Sapling, VerusID, or wildcard address to send funds from. "*", "R*", or "i*" are valid wildcards
2. "outputs"         (array, required) An array of json objects representing currencies, amounts, and destinations to send.
  [{
   "currency": "name"  (string, required) Name of the source currency to send in this output, defaults to native of chain
   "amount":amount    (numeric, required) The numeric amount of currency, denominated in source currency
   "convertto":"name", (string, optional) Valid currency to convert to, either a reserve of a fractional, or fractional
   "addconversionfees":"false", (bool, optional) Calculate additional conversion fees to convert the full amount specified after fees
   "exportto":"name",  (string, optional) Valid chain or system name or ID to export to
   "exportid":"false", (bool, optional) if cross-chain export, export the full ID to the destination chain (will cost to export)
   "exportcurrency":"false", (bool, optional) if cross-chain export, export the currency definition (will cost to export)
   "feecurrency":"name", (string, optional) Valid currency that should be pulled from the current wallet and used to pay fee
   "via":"name",    (string, optional) If source and destination currency are reserves, via is a common fractional to convert through
   "address":"dest"   (stri

What are the required arguments for the `sendcurrency` command?

The required arguments for the `sendcurrency` command are:

1. "fromaddress" (string, required) - The address to send funds from.
2. "outputs" (array, required) - An array of JSON objects representing currencies, amounts, and destinations to send.

sendcurrency "fromaddress" '[{"address":... ,"amount":...},...]' (minconfs) (feeamount) (returntxtemplate)This sends one or many Verus outputs to one or many addresses on the same or another chain.

What is the purpose of the "outputs" array in the `sendcurrency` command?

The "outputs" array in the `sendcurrency` command is used to specify one or multiple transactions to be sent. Each object in the array represents a single transaction and must contain the following required properties:

1. "currency" (string, required) - The name of the source currency to send.
2. "amount" (numeric, required) - The numeric amount of currency to send.

What are some optional properties that can be included in the "outputs" array objects?

Some optional properties that can be included in the "outputs" array objects are:

1. "convertto" (string, optional) - A valid currency to convert to.
2. "addconversionfees" (bool, optional) - Calculate additional conversion fees to convert the full amount specified after fees.
3. "exportto" (string, optional) - A valid chain or system name or ID to export to.
4. "exportid" (bool, optional) - If cross-chain export, export the full ID to the destination chain.
5. "exportcurrency" (bool, optional) - If cross-chain export, export the currency definition.
6. "feecurrency" (string, optional) - A valid currency that should be pulled from the current wallet and used to pay the fee.
7. "via" (string, optional) - If source and destination currency are reserves, via is a common fractional to convert through.

What is the purpose of the "fromaddress" argument in the `sendcurrency` command?

The "fromaddress" argument in the `sendcurrency` command specifies the address to send funds from. If specified, all funds will be taken from that address. If not specified, funds may come from any source set of UTXOs controlled by the wallet. Wildcards such as "*", "R*", or "i*" are also valid.

sendcurrency "fromaddress" '[{"address":... ,"amount":...},...]' (minconfs) (feeamount) (returntxtemplate)This sends one or many Verus outputs to one or many addresses on the same or another chain.
